summary: Implements an iterative bidirectional routing strategy to select an optimal qubit layout for a quantum circuit. Starting from random (or supplied) layouts, it performs a full routing pass forward, then routes the reversed circuit, repeating until a layout that reduces total swap cost is found. The pass also handles ancilla allocation and can operate either as a combined layout‑and‑routing pass or as a pure layout selector.
business_intent: Reduce the number of SWAP gates required to map a quantum circuit onto a device’s coupling map, thereby improving execution fidelity and performance on NISQ hardware.
